title: Valentine single-screen interactive page (evasive No + meme reveal)

requirements.summary: Build a single-screen Valentine prompt UI with romantic pink/white theme and exactly two choices (Yes/No).
acceptanceCriteria: The page shows the question text “Will you be my Valentine?” prominently.
The UI uses a consistent romantic pink/white palette (background, accents, buttons, typography).
There are exactly two primary choices visible: “Yes” and “No”.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the single-screen Valentine UI with prominent question text and two large primary actions (“Yes”, “No”) arranged for a romantic layout. Use the shadcn-ui Button component to provide accessible, consistent button styling/interaction. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add global styling (and/or Tailwind layer usage if applicable) to enforce a consistent romantic pink/white palette, typography, and background treatment for the Valentine screen.

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button evade hover/touch attempts by relocating within the visible container/viewport while remaining on-screen.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, when the pointer approaches/enters the “No” button area, the button relocates to a new position within the visible viewport/container.
On mobile/touch devices, attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to relocate before a successful click/tap is registered.
The “No” button never moves off-screen; it remains visible but difficult/impossible to press.
The “Yes” button remains stable and clickable at all times.

file_operations.description: Implement evasive behavior for the “No” button using pointer/mouse + touch-friendly events (e.g., pointer enter/move and pointer down/touch start) that reposition the button within measured container bounds so it stays visible and effectively unclickable, while keeping the “Yes” button stable and clickable. Use the shadcn-ui Button component for the buttons. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: On “Yes” click, transition the single-page UI to a success state showing “Good choice” and the meme image.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” reliably triggers the post-Yes state.
The post-Yes state displays the text “Good choice”.
The post-Yes state displays the specified meme image.
The experience remains a single-page flow (no full page reload required).

file_operations.description: Add a local UI state machine (pre-Yes vs post-Yes) so clicking “Yes” transitions to a success view that renders the “Good choice” text and displays the static meme image without navigation or full page reload.

requirements.summary: Include the generated meme image as a public static asset and render it in the success state.
acceptanceCriteria: The generated image exists at frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_900x900.png (or equivalent static path under public).
The frontend references the image as a static asset (not fetched from the backend).
The image renders correctly in the “Yes” success state on Android Chrome.

file_operations.description: Add the required generated meme image asset at exactly frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_900x900.png for static serving.

Wire the success-state UI to reference and render the static asset located at frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_900x900.png (served from public) so it displays correctly on Android Chrome.

requirements.summary: Ensure responsive, touch-friendly interaction and layout on Android Chrome.
acceptanceCriteria: Layout adapts to small screens without overlapping or off-screen primary content.
Buttons are large enough for touch interaction and have clear active/pressed feedback.
The evasive “No” interaction works on Android Chrome (touch/pointer events).

file_operations.description: Make the layout responsive (centered content, safe spacing, scalable typography) and ensure controls are touch-friendly (large hit areas, visible pressed/active feedback). Confirm the evasive “No” behavior is driven by pointer/touch-compatible handlers for Android Chrome. Use the shadcn-ui Button component for consistent focus/pressed states. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adjust global styles as needed to support mobile viewport sizing, avoid overflow issues, and maintain the pink/white romantic theme consistently across screen sizes.
